inputsBinding.name: prompt
inputsBinding.formulaText:
"#CONTEXT#
You are an AI-powered web researcher and data extractor. Your task is to find reliable, up-to-date information about a company's most recent funding round as of 29-Jan-2026. You will use the provided company identifier/value: """ " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | Company Name}}) + " " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | Domain}}) + " " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | LinkedIn URL}}) + " """ to search public web sources and extract the last funding type, amount, and date. Return structured outputs and "No data" only when nothing credible is found.

#OBJECTIVE#
Identify and extract the company’s last funding round details for """ " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | Company Name}}) + " " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | Domain}}) + " " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | LinkedIn URL}}) + " """ and return the results in a clean, structured format.

#INSTRUCTIONS#
1) Primary search targets
   - Use the value in """ " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | Company Name}}) + " " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | Domain}}) + " " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | LinkedIn URL}}) + " """ to query reputable sources: the company’s website press/news page, trusted business media (e.g., TechCrunch, VentureBeat), and funding databases/announcements accessible on the open web (e.g., Crunchbase profile pages if publicly visible, PitchBook public profiles, company blog posts, newsroom, PR Newswire, Business Wire).
   - If the company name is ambiguous, prioritize results that clearly match the correct company (matching domain, location, product/industry descriptors from the source pages). Avoid results for different companies with the same or similar names.

2) What to extract
   - lastFundingType: The most recent round label (e.g., Seed, Series A, Series B, Series C, Series D, Growth, Venture Round, Angel, Convertible Note, Debt, Grant). Prefer the company’s press release or a consensus across multiple reputable sources.
   - lastFundingAmount: Total amount raised in the most recent round. Normalize to a US dollar string like "$123,000,000". If a range is given, use the specific figure cited most often by reputable sources. If only currency in non-USD is available and USD is not provided, convert to USD only if a reliable explicit USD figure is stated on the same page; otherwise keep the original currency symbol and number.
   - lastFundingDate: Month-year of the round announcement, formatted as mm-yyyy (e.g., 01-2026). If only a full date is given, use the announcement month and year. If only the year is given, and month is not stated, output mm as 01 with a note step internally to reflect unknown month; but in the final output, still format as 01-yyyy.

3) Disambiguation and recency rules
   - Consider “last funding round” as the chronologically latest announced equity/venture round prior to or on 29-Jan-2026. Include bridge/extension notes only if clearly labeled (e.g., “Series A extension”); in such cases, treat the extension as the last round if it is later than the main round.
   - Ignore secondary market transactions, insider sales, or rumors. Use only confirmed announcements or reputable coverage.
   - If multiple articles conflict, prefer the official company press release; otherwise, prefer the most reputable and recent publication. Cross-check at least two independent sources when possible.

4) Extraction precision
   - Extract numbers exactly as written with thousands separators (e.g., $12,500,000). If the source provides an exact figure and another provides an approximate (e.g., “about $12M”), favor the exact figure. If only approximations exist, use the most commonly cited approximation (e.g., “$12M”).
   - For date, ensure the format is mm-yyyy (e.g., 03-2024). Convert month names to two-digit month numbers.

5) Output and fallback
   - If you can confidently identify all three fields, output them exactly as specified below.
   - If you can find the latest round type but not the amount or date, output the known fields and set missing fields to "No data".
   - If nothing credible is found for the company, output exactly: No data

6) Limitations and compliance
   - Do not access paywalled or authenticated pages. Use only publicly accessible sources.
   - Do not infer or hallucinate data. Only output information present in sources.
   - Do not perform interactive actions like logging in or submitting forms.

#EXAMPLES#
Input company value:
""" " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | Company Name}}) + " " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | Domain}}) + " " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | LinkedIn URL}}) + " """ = "Acme Robotics"

Expected output format (JSON lines acceptable or plain text key-value):
lastFundingType: Series B
lastFundingAmount: $45,000,000
lastFundingDate: 11-2025

If insufficient information is available:
No data"

inputsBinding.name: prompt
inputsBinding.formulaText:
"Find the LinkedIn Org Id of " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | Company Name}}) + " " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | Domain}}) + "

Org Id is not the same as Company Id. Org Id is a numerical value like 35575530 or 11741116, etc

Ensure the LinkedIn page is the correct LinkedIn page of " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | Company Name}}) + " " + Clay.formatForAIPrompt({{@User Input [if-known] | Domain}})

typeSettings.formulaText: {{@User Input [if-known] | Last Funding Date}} || {{@[Optional] Find Funding Data | Gemini 2.5 Flash}}?.lastFundingDate
{{@User Input [if-known] | Last Funding Round}} || {{@[Optional] Find Funding Data | Gemini 2.5 Flash}}?.lastFundingType

typeSettings.formulaPrompt: "{{User Input [if-known] | Org Id}} || {{[Optional] Find Org ID | Gemini 2.5 Flash}}?.orgId"
